content:
aladdin2 said
TB Windows puts some messages in my spam folder even though I've put the addresses in my contacts and told it to check contacts before moving them to spam folder. It would be nice if the "Spam" button became a "not Spam" button.

> It would be nice if the "Spam" button became a "not Spam" button. It actually is. On a message sent to Spam, just click the Spam icon. That tells TB to unmark it as spam and moves the message back to your Inbox.
creator: siffemoz

content:
You could use the add-on ImportExportTools.

But Thunderbird allows sorting on about twenty fields, and reading e-mail must be easier in Thunderbird than in a spreadsheet. Say more about what you need?
creator: mozilla98

content: the folders were originally configured via "Addtional Identities" in the account settings.
